meanings.sent1: After playing in the rain, she needed to reclothe in dry clothes.
meanings.sent2: She reclothed in warmer attire before heading out into the cold.
meanings.sent3: The magician reclothed in a different outfit for each magic trick.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar reclothed itself in a vibrant cocoon before emerging as a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The superhero quickly reclothed in their costume to save the day.

meanings.definition: The act of putting on new clothes.
meanings.sent1: Her reclothing after the party involved changing into pajamas.
meanings.sent2: Reclothing for the event required a formal dress and shoes.
meanings.sent3: The reclothing of the mannequin in the store display caught the shoppers' attention.
meanings.sent4: The reclothing of the scarecrow with fresh straw made it look more lifelike.
meanings.sent5: Reclothing in stylish outfits made the fashion show a success.
